# loadTopShelfContent(completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Provides the content you want to display in the top shelf for your app.

## Declaration

```swift
func loadTopShelfContent(completionHandler: @escaping ((any TVTopShelfContent)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
func loadTopShelfContent() async -> (any TVTopShelfContent)?
```

## Parameters

- **completionHandler**: The handler block to execute with your content. This block has no return value and takes the following parameter:



## Discussion



The system calls this method when it needs your app’s top shelf content. In your implementation, create the [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfItem] objects you want to display and wrap them in a matching [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfContent] object. The specific objects you create depends on how you want to display your content. You can display items using one of the following interface styles:

- A *carousel interface* displays [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfCarouselItem] objects in a horizontal line. The user swipes left and right to navigate from item to item.
- A *sectioned interface* groups [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfSectionedItem] objects together and presents them in a scrolling list.
- An *inset interface* organizes either carousel or sectioned items and insets them by a specified amount.

If you call the completionHandler with a `nil` value, the system displays a static image provided by your app.
